DataElement.preferredName: Colon Carcinoma Colonoscopy Current Performed Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a current endoscopic examination of the luminal surface of the colon as an evaluation for a malignant tumor usually arising from the epithelium lining the large intestinal mucosa was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a current endoscopic examination of the luminal surface of the colon as an evaluation for a malignant tumor usually arising from the epithelium lining the large intestinal mucosa being performed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor usually arising from the epithelium lining the large intestinal mucosa.  Colon carcinoma is one of the most common malignancies in both males and females, and is especially common in North America and Europe.  Grossly, most colon carcinomas are polypoid or ulcerating lesions. Microscopically, adenocarcinoma is the most frequently seen morphologic subtype.  Prognosis depends on the stage of the disease (depth of invasion, metastasis to regional/distal lymph nodes or other anatomic sites). -- 2004:Endoscopic examination of the luminal surface of the colon.

Concepts.definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm that arises from the colon and invades through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas.
Endoscopic examination of the luminal surface of the colon.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
Executed and carried through to completion.
